message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI 

The paper discusses a new approach to representing probability distributions using Fourier representations, which is a topic commonly studied in the machine learning subfield of probabilistic graphical models (PGMs). Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the application of this approach to variable elimination, which is a common inference algorithm used in PGMs, suggesting that it could be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the use of Fourier representations involves concepts from signal processing and information theory, which could make cs.IT (Information Theory) a relevant sub-category. Finally, the paper also discusses the computational advantages of this approach, which could make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
